item.description:
Yale school of music presents
Help Can't wait - A concert to benefit relief efforts in China, Myanmar, and the Amerian South. Details below.

Most importantly, of prime interest is that the NHC's own lovely and talented Ms. Elizabeth Fleming, who recently performed at the illustrious Carnegie Hall, will treat us to her Strauss Serenade (with solos!), and the Mozart Clarinet Concerto.

Meet at Sprague Hally at 6:30, we'll take seats at 6:40 for the 7pm showtime. These concerts fill up quickly, so come soon for a good seat!
-Neil
203-645-2008

Admission to the concert is free, however there is a
suggested donation of $20 for disaster relief.

If you make a contribution online, please print a
copy of your receipt as it will serve as your ticket.

Tickets are also available by phone and at the Sprague Hall
Box Office 9am-5pm on Monday and Tuesday
and 9am-7:30pm the night of the concert.



Benefit Program


Chinese Solo flute piece
Mingzhu Wang (?07)

Meguru - Traditional by Ovambo
Bawo Thixo Somandla - Matyila, arr. Mzilikazi Khumalo

Members of the Yale Glee Club

?Ich habe genung? (from Cantata BWV 82) by J. S. Bach
Joshua Copeland, baritone & Douglas Dickson, piano

Meditation from Thais by Massenet
Jaewon Choi, Violin

Serenade in Eb, Op. 7 (1881) by Richard Strauss
Thomas C. Duffy, conductor
Members of the Philharmonia Orchestra of Yale

The Unanswered Question by Charles Ives ?98
Toshiyuki Shimada, conductor
Yale Symphony Orchestra

Irish Tune from County Derry by Percy Aldridge Grainger
Thomas C. Duffy, conductor
Yale Concert Band

Clarinet Concerto in A major, K. 622 by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
II. Adagio
David Shifrin, Clarinet
Members of the Philharmonia Orchestra of Yale



How You'll Make a Difference


All proceeds will be given to major charities
providing services to the victims of the earthquakes in China,
the typhoon in Myanmar and the recent tornadoes in the United States.

To ensure that these three disaster areas will be served,
benefits will be shared by the American Red Cross,
Save the Children and AmeriCares.

This is the third ?Help Can't Wait? concert organized
by musical organizations at Yale. The first was in response to the
Tsunami and earthquakes in Southeast Asia and the Pacific in 2004
and the second to benefit victims of Hurricane Katrina in 2005.
item.name: Help Can't Wait - a Yale concert fundraiser with NHC member Elizabeth
